item.description:
Yes kids, there are other Monadnocks... and there are Heffalumps & Woozles too. But where we’re going we shouldn’t have to worry. It doesn’t take a bear (or a man) of enormous brains to know that Hefflumps and Woozles don’t exist like the cold.


And yes, as you can see, it’s last minute. I apologize. But, it’s still a minute, and sixty seconds is not so small these days. Just think about waiting for a web page to download, or if you like, about how small things can be made into big things, molehills into mountains, that sort of thing; your choice.

Which brings me to why I’m writing this!!! Mountains. I wanna climb mountains. Not just any mountains... local mountains... MA mountains, NH mountains, mountains that I hope to snowshoe this winter, preferably when there’s snow on top. And Pack Monadnock & North Pack may just be one of them… two of them. But first, I’m gonna need to hike’em, sans snow to know.

 

It will all begin at 9 AM, at Miller State Park (map) as we hike north up the Wapack Trail, summit Pack Mondanock and continue until we reach the Cliff Trail. We’ll then follow the Cliff Trail east as it circles (counter-clockwise) back around to the Wapack and the North Pack Monadnock summit.

After, we’ll head back via the Wapack (heading south) and re-summit Pack Monadnock as we return to our cars by way of the Marion Davis Trail.

At this point, we'll get in our cars, start the engines, drive to the park entrance, turn right and head west on Rt 101 to Peterborough, turning right on Grove St. where we will park in front of Harlow’s so that we can get a little some’em some’em to eat or drink, should you like.

So, be prepared for changes of temperature and strong winds (and should you go to Harlow's, cold brews and warm food). Dress in layers and have a wind/rain jacket. Bring plenty of insulation, water, food, and something warm to drink. We will hike at a steady moderate pace. Severe weather cancels this event. 

PS. This is a 7 1/2 mile hike w/ several steep sections, and should there be snow or ice on the summit, microspikes or other additional traction devices will be needed. [I will call Friday AM to get that question answered.]


EQUIPMENT CHECKLIST

Cold Weather/Fall Essentials (required):
• Synthetic Quick-drying Pants
• Synthetic Quick-drying L/S Shirt
• Sturdy Hiking Boots/shoes (preferably waterproof)
• Synthetic/Wool Socks
• Insulated/Fleece Jacket
• Light/Mid-weight Insulating Layers (undershirt/underpants)
• Extra pair of Socks
• Hat/Gloves
• Rain/Soft Shell Jacket/Pants
• Water (2-3L)
• Headlamp/Flashlight
• Map/Compass/Whistle
• Lunch
• Snack/Energy Food (extra food)
• MICROspikes, STABLicers, ect... (a must when there's snow or ice on the trail)


the Remaining Essentials:
• Medications/First Aid Supplies
• Emergency Blanket (so small & light, there's hardly a reason not to have one in your pack)
• Fire (waterproof matches, lighter, starter)
• Repair Kit/Knife

Optional:
• Sunscreen/Sunglasses/Bug Repellant/Toiletries
• Light-weight Wind Jacket (if your insulated or rain jacket isn’t windproof)
• Hand Warmers
• Trekking Poles
• Gaiters
• Light-weight Emergency Shelter
• Camera/Binoculars

Important:
NO JEANS, NO SNEAKERS, NO COTTON CLOTHING (They get wet, They stay wet & They won’t keep you warm). ALSO, LET'S NOT UNDERESTIMATE ANYTHING, so come prepared for the worst: cold cold temps., wet weather, early darkness and lots of wind.

Directions:
From Leominster & Rt 2 West, take Exit 31B. Follow Rt 12 North to Fitchburg, turning right on Rt 31 North. Follow Rt 31 to Greenville, NH and bear left onto NH Rt 45 North, follow to Rt 101. Turn Left onto NH 101 West and drive approx. 2 miles before turning right into Miller State Park.

http://maps.google.com/maps...


Additional Information:

Distance: approx. 7 1/2 miles
Elevation Gain (total): approx. 2400 ft
Exposure: along Cliff Trail

Difficulty: Moderate
Pace: Moderate
Approx. Hike Time (including stops): 6:00+ hrs

Sunrise: 6:44 a.m.
Sunset: 4:22 p.m.

Approx. Temp. Hi: low 50’s
Approx. Temp. Lo: mid 30’s

5-Day Weather Outlook:
http://www.weather.com/weather/5-day/USNH0183

Liability Waiver:
As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: From Leominster & Rt 2 West, take Exit 31B. Follow Rt 12 north, turn right on Rt 31 North. Bear left @ Rt 45 North follow to Rt 101. Turn left & head west, drive approx. 2 miles, MSP is on the right; I'll be in the grey Jetta; cell: 860-460-1500
item.name: Pack & North Pack (the lesser known Monadnocks)... out & back
